topic.title: Accessing the Dashboard
topic.abstract: The Horizon dashboard provides cloud admins a web GUI to perform domain admin tasks such as user and project administration.The Horizon dashboard provides cloud admins a web GUI to perform domain admin tasks such as user and project administration.

body.note: The dashboard in is pre-configured to support only the v3 Keystone API. If you upgrade from an earlier version you will be automatically be migrated to the Keystone v3 API. If you still want to use the Keystone v2 API, you will be limited to API/CLI use only as there is no dashboard support for the Keystone v2 API.

section.title: Accessing the dashboard
section.p: Prior to accessing the dashboard you will need to retrieve your admin user password. For more details, see .

If your administrator set a hostname value for external_name in your network_groups.yml file during the configuration process for your cloud then Horizon will be accessed over port 443 (https) on that hostname.

The output of that command will show you the virtual IP address for Horizon that you should use.
The default username for the Administrator user is admin. You will use that along with the password you retrieved earlier.
